docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in Gauteng Province, which includes Johannesburg, said they would provide the AIDS drug nevirapine in public hospitals to prevent women from transmitting H.I.V. to their babies during birth. The decision comes weeks after the leader of KwaZulu-Natal Province made a similar announcement. The national government, which has been reluctant to expand its pilot program for pregnant women infected with H.I.V., has decided to allow the nevirapine program to extend to provinces with hospitals and clinics that have enough staff members and supplies. Rachel L. Swarns (NYT)

headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: South Africa: Wider Availability Of Aids Drug

docs.lead_paragraph: When NBC announced last week that it had signed its hit comedy ''Friends'' to return for a ninth season, the news was mainly about the stunning money -- $7 million an episode -- that it took to get the show to come back. But the truly stunning comeback had already taken place. By generating new hot story lines and high-decibel laughs, ''Friends'' emerged last fall from the kind of malaise, characterized by diminishing ratings and laughs, that has afflicted many hits in their later years. As it did, the show stormed back to the top of the ratings and back into the hearts of its fans, and the pockets of its network.
docs.abstract: Article on how new plot twists have sparked NBC's eight-season-old comedy series Friends; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Abortion in Africa remains steeped in taboo and against the law throughout most of the continent. But it is widely practiced outside of the confines of modern medicine. Some girls pour malaria pills down their throats, a dozen at a time. Traditional healers swear by a mixture of herbs and tree bark. Desperate women may sit in the very back of a vehicle as it roars along on a rough country road in hopes of shaking the embryo loose.

headline.main: Despite a Ban, Teaching Safe Abortions in Kenya

docs.abstract: Dr Solomon Orero teaches safe abortions in Kenya, where they are banned but widely practiced with disastrous outcomes outside confines of modern medicine; travels around as member of Kisumu Medical and Educational Trust teaching health practioners; he comments; World Health Organization estimates one in 150 abortions in Africa end in death; photo; maps (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: It should come as no surprise that Britney Spears emerges unscathed (though not artistically ennobled) from her debut movie, ''Crossroads.'' In this bland female road movie, which follows three friends on a cross-country trip from Georgia to Los Angeles, Ms. Spears's character, Lucy, is nothing less than Little Miss Perfect. Along the way she finds true puppy love with Ben (Anson Mount), the handsome stubbly faced musician who chauffeurs the girls in his 1973 Buick convertible.

headline.main: A Britney Spears Vehicle That Bypasses the Bumps

docs.abstract: Stephen Holden reviews movie Crossroads, directed by Tamra Davis; Britney Spears and Anson Mount star; photo (M)
